column1: Gúthwinë was the sword of Éomer
column2: borne by him at the Battle of the Hornburg
column3: where he drew it alongside Aragorn to drive away the wild men battering the gate of the Hornburg.  Presumably Éomer also used Gúthwinë at the Battle of the Pelennor Fields
column4: where he cast his sword into the sunlight and sang as he caught it
column5: upon seeing the Standard of Elendil appear on the lead ship approaching on the Anduin.

column1: The name Gúthwinë is said to be Rohirric
